decision_conditions:
Reason : 1 - By reason of its siting, size and design the proposed development would be an incongruous, unsympathetic and visually intrusive addition to the subject property, streetscene and locality. It would fail to physically integrate with its surroundings, would detract from the local spatial character, and would fail to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Clapham Common Conservation Area. The proposal would therefore be contrary to s.72(1) of the Planning (LBCA) Act 1990 and Policies DMS1 (General development principles), DMS2 (Managing the historic environment) and DMH5 (Alterations and extensions) of the Council's Development Management Policies Document (2016), the Supplementary Planning Document: Housing (2016) and the NPPF (2021).
Reason : 2 - The proposed development would constitute an unneighbourly form of development that would harm the amenity of neighbouring properties in the form of loss of outlook, being overbearing, creating an increased sense of enclosure and potentially excessive noise and disturbance. The proposals have also failed to demonstrate that there would not be unacceptable harm to neighbouring windows in respect to reductions in daylight and sunlight. The proposals would therefore be contrary to policies DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (2016), the Housing SPD (2016) and the NPPF (2021).
Reason : 3 - In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application. We have made available detailed advice in the form of our statutory policies in the Local Plan consisting of the Core Strategy, Development Management Policies Document, Supplementary Planning documents and where appropriate the Site Specific Allocations Document as well as offering a full pre application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition further guidance was offered to the applicant by the case officer during the processing of the application to identify amendments to address those elements of the scheme considered unacceptable. However, the necessary amendments to make the application acceptable are substantial and would materially change the development proposal. They would require further consultations to be undertaken prior to determination, which could not take place within the statutory determination period specified by the Department of Communities and Local Government. You are therefore encouraged to consider submission of a fresh application incorporating the material amendments set out below which are necessary to make the scheme acceptable. 

Required amendments: Reduce size of roof terrace.
description: Alterations including erection of a mansard roof extension to main rear roof with solar panels above and extension above three-storey rear addition with screening to create roof terrace .
